meanings.definition: To act in an exaggerated or excessive manner.
meanings.sent1: She always overacts in school plays, making her characters seem unreal.
meanings.sent2: He overacts in every scene, making the audience cringe at his dramatic gestures.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the actor overacts his role, causing the audience to burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her performance in the play overacts the emotions, turning a serious scene into a comedy.
meanings.sent5: The actor's tendency to overacts makes his characters unforgettable, but not always in a good way.

meanings.definition: To perform in a melodramatic or over-the-top way.
meanings.sent1: The actress overacts in every movie, making her performances seem exaggerated.
meanings.sent2: He overacts his lines, making the audience roll their eyes at his over-the-top delivery.
meanings.sent3: In the play, the villain overacts his evil laugh, causing the audience to chuckle instead of fear.
meanings.sent4: Her singing overacts the emotions, turning a heartfelt song into a melodramatic performance.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's tendency to overacts his jokes always brings laughter, even if it's a bit forced.
